sentence.text: Recently, autosomal recessive loss-of-function mutations in EXPH5 (encoding exophilin-5, also known as keratinocyte development, a protein involved in intracellular vesicle transport) were identified in a new mechanobullous disease resembling a form of epidermolysis bullosa simplex (EBS).
This case represents the third pedigree with keratinocyte development mutations resulting in inherited skin fragility.
